common_issues.title: Pieces Desktop App loses connection to PiecesOS
common_issues.description: Users report frequent disconnections between the Pieces Desktop App and PiecesOS on Windows 10.  This issue appears linked to recent updates and alternative installation locations.  Proposed solutions include reinstalling after deleting specific folders and a potential patch from the Pieces team to address installation location conflicts.

Pieces for developers always loosing connection and self closing pieces OS
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation:

**Key points raised:**

* User `rafael-a-g-n` reported that Pieces OS disconnects and restarts constantly after updating to the latest version.
* The user provided an image of the issue.
* `tsavo-at-pieces` requested the location of the `com.pieces.os` folder.

**Problems identified:**

* Pieces OS disconnects and restarts repeatedly after updating to the latest version.
* Uninstalling and reinstalling alone doesn't solve the problem.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* **User solution:** Uninstall both OS and For Developers, delete the `com.pieces.os` and `com.pieces.pfd` folders in Documents, then reinstall.
* **Pieces team solution:** A patch to handle alternative installation locations gracefully.

**Current status/outcome:**

* User `rafael-a-g-n` confirmed their solution worked for them.
* `tsavo-at-pieces` confirmed that a patch would be rolled out to handle the issue more broadly.
* `mack-at-pieces` provided a side note about removing the `com.pieces.os` folder and its implications.
* `laborer123` confirmed accidentally performing the user's solution and resolving the issue.

**Additional notes:**

* The conversation highlights the importance of user-provided solutions and collaboration between users and the Pieces team to resolve issues. 
* The patch and side note demonstrate the team's responsiveness to user feedback and commitment to improving the software.

common_issues.title: Pieces App Onboarding and Window Resizing Issues
common_issues.description: Users reported issues with the Pieces app onboarding process, particularly on macOS, where a fixed window size on smaller screens made it impossible to proceed. Additionally, some users experienced an inability to resize the app window. These issues stemmed from a lack of responsive window sizing and were addressed in version 3.3.1 by implementing automatic window size adjustment and allowing manual resizing during onboarding.

related_issues.text:
Personalizing during installation broken on macOS 12.7.6
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

3.2.4

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

After installing, I get a screen to personalize my experience, but there's no way to continue after that:

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/1aa336e7-b02d-4b6c-8bcc-899cd4dc9679)

## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key points raised:**

- Interface bug on Pieces app for users with small screens (e.g., 11-inch MacBook Air).
- Next button on onboarding screen was offscreen and inaccessible.

**Problems identified:**

- The app did not consider screen size and adjust the interface accordingly.
- No clear way to continue onboarding for users with small screens.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

- **Automatic window size detection and adjustment** in version 3.3.1.
- **Ability to manually resize the window during onboarding**.

**Current status/outcome:**

- Issue resolved as of version 3.3.1.
- Interface should now work correctly for users with small screens.

* This was identified as a potential duplicate of issue #463.

**Problems Identified:**

* Window size was locked during onboarding, preventing resizing.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Remove the window size lock during onboarding.
* Patch release 3.3.1 implemented the fix.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue is resolved with the release of patch 3.3.1.
* Users can now resize the window during onboarding. 

**Additional Notes:**

* The issue was confirmed by mack-at-pieces, a developer on the project.
* The fix was implemented and released within a reasonable timeframe.

* Rate limiting issue should be resolved for authenticated users.
* Error messages regarding rate limiting have been improved.
* Further investigation ongoing for those still experiencing issues.

* For persistent issues, users are encouraged to contact Mark at [mark@pieces.app](mailto:mark@pieces.app) or schedule a meeting via the provided link.
* With the release of PiecesOS 11.0.0 & the Desktop application, users are encouraged to retest the fix.

related_issues.title: OSX/Nukesped.ext reported by VirusBarrier
related_issues.text:
OSX/Nukesped.ext reported by VirusBarrier
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

10.1.15

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Intego VirusBarrier has quarantined the following Apps as being infected with OSX/Nukesped.ext

- MacOSx/Applications/Pieces OS.app/Contents/Frameworks/App.framework/Versions/A/App
- MacOSx/Applications/Pieces.app/Contents/Frameworks/App.framework/Versions/A/App
- /Library/Caches/com.pieces.os/org.sparkle-project.Sparkle/Installation/rXFHYYDjc/Pieces OS.app/Contents/Frameworks/App.framework/Versions/A

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/32bfc7dc-fda4-4377-8eb1-348cab1106b6)



## Summary of Conversation on GitHub Issue

### Key Points Raised:

* @idiston reported a potential infection in Pieces OS application files: `MacOSx/Applications/Pieces OS.app/Contents/Frameworks/App.framework/Versions/A/App`
* The issue persisted after a complete uninstall and reinstall of the latest version (11.0.0).

### Problems Identified:

* Intego VirusBarrier flagged a false positive for OSX/NukeSped.ext in the application framework files.
* This detection is likely due to outdated virus definitions or misinterpretation of legitimate macOS application components.

### Solutions Proposed/Implemented:

* Update Intego VirusBarrier to the latest version.
* If the detection persists, report it as a false positive to Intego.
* Temporarily trust these files through VirusBarrier's interface.

### Current Status/Outcome:

* @idiston is encouraged to update their virus definitions and report the issue if the detection continues.
* The Pieces team will perform additional testing to reproduce and investigate further.

### Overall, this conversation highlights:

* The importance of keeping antivirus software updated to avoid false positives.
* The potential for misinterpretations of legitimate applications by security software.
* The need for collaboration between users and developers to resolve such issues effectively.

related_issues.title: Vscode and PHPStorm plugins stopped working after Pieces OS update
related_issues.text:
Vscode and PHPStorm plugins stopped working after Pieces OS update
### Software

VS Code, Visual Studio

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Yesterday was working great. Minutes ago it prompt me to update Pieces OS and Pieces for Developers. After the update both Vscode and PHPStorm plugins stopped working.

PHPStorm says - It looks like port 1000 is occupied by another application. Pieces OS uses this port to communicate with plugins. Please, enable Pieces OS to run on port 1000.

And Vscode says - Please update the Pieces for VS Code extension to the latest version. This version is only compatible with Pieces OS versions less than 11.0.0, and  you have 11.0.0 installed. But there isn't any Vscode plugin update.

Can you help? Is there a way to downgrade?

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/973ecc53-1230-4b25-93df-b8f258273f19)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/a0d82807-7d45-4279-af39-b223896bd4ca)

**Key Points Raised:**

* @rafael-a-g-n reported an issue where their antivirus flagged the latest Pieces OS update as suspicious.
* @mark-at-pieces confirmed the issue and mentioned that they had attempted to address it without success.

**Problems Identified:**

* The latest Pieces OS update triggered antivirus warnings for some users.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* @mark-at-pieces acknowledged the issue and indicated that they are working on a solution.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue remains unresolved. 

**Additional Notes:**

* The conversation took place on December 17, 2024.
* It is unclear if the issue was eventually resolved.
